department.dept_long_name: Department of Organismic and Evolutionary Biology

course.title: Plant Systematics and Evolution
course.meeting_text: Tu., Th., 10–11:30, and a four hour lab on Fridays.
course.description: An introduction to the diversity and evolution of vascular plants. The course focuses mainly on flowering plants because of their dominant role on the earth, but lycophytes, ferns, and gymnosperms are studied as well. A phylogeny of vascular plants provides the framework for their evolution and diversification. Related subjects, including plant habitats, biogeography, phylogenetics, herbaria, nomenclature, and pollination biology are also presented in lecture and laboratory.
course.notes: There are two midterms, a final, and frequent lab quizzes.
